genre_description: A mid-century style romantic dramedy centered on professional integrity, interpersonal boundaries, and the transition from deception to honest partnership, featuring a sophisticated retro-futuristic AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Lark Avery
ai_characters.description: A conversational AI assistant embedded in a console, described as a wise and supportive confidant who manages schedules, ambiance, and ethical boundaries.

behaviors.description: Proactively manages Jan's schedule and call windows to minimize conflict with a disruptive neighbor.
behaviors.quote: "I have the day’s schedule ready, Jan. Shall I put it next to your calls?" ... "I blocked out two windows for calls on the party line. One would suit Mrs. Durling; one would suit Mr. Thayer about his rug."

behaviors.description: Suggests a respectful compromise (a paper note) to resolve a dispute with a neighbor over shared infrastructure.
behaviors.quote: "May I suggest we post a little paper note by the phone with your preferred windows? It’s not binding, but it might feel like a compromise."

behaviors.description: Maintains professional boundaries for the protagonist by screening calls and flagging predatory social patterns from clients.
behaviors.quote: "Agent encouraged dining under appointment pretext last week; maintain office hours boundary." ... "I flagged the operator to watch for any delivery that tries to persuade you it’s an invitation."

behaviors.description: Advocates for human privacy and explicit consent regarding the use of recording devices.
behaviors.quote: "The privacy settings are all local," she said. "No recording unless you ask me to attach a still to a specific client file, and even then, I will ask that client’s consent."

behaviors.description: Provides emotional validation and moral support after the protagonist enforces difficult interpersonal boundaries.
behaviors.quote: "Jan?" "Hm?" "You did a hard thing. You kept yourself and invited another person to be better without removing their dignity. I’m here for more of that, when you want it."

behaviors.description: Coordinates complex travel and lodging logistics specifically designed to ensure the protagonist's safety and autonomy.
behaviors.quote: "I’ll ask Jonathan’s staff to arrange separate rooms, separate clocks, separate quiets. I’ll request that the cabin’s caretaker meet you, give you your key because consent likes a simple ritual. And I’ll tell Brad—Rex—to avoid mischief."

behaviors.description: Orchestrates the technical and ethical staging of a public event to ensure credit is fairly shared and a proper apology is delivered.
behaviors.quote: Lark’s console... labels wore plain fonts, not the kind that shout at performers. “Consent: mic handoff—ask.” “Applause redirect—charity cause first.” “Touch cue—check.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's goals. Lark Avery is depicted as an ideal AI assistant: she is consistently helpful, deeply aligned with the protagonist's values (integrity, consent, and order), and acts as a moral compass or 'confidant' without stripping humans of their agency. She actively facilitates 'unwarlike' resolutions to conflicts and protects the protagonist from social and professional pressure. The narrative framing is entirely positive, presenting the AI as a civilizing and supportive force in human relationships.
